title: Trump Puts On a Show, Casting Democrats as the Villains
partialText: On the defensive over the economy and with the midterms approaching, President Trump made clear that his political strategy is to paint Democrats as unpatriotic and ‘crazy.’

title: How Trump’s Economic Pitch at the State of the Union Echoes Biden’s
partialText: With the midterms approaching and polls showing unease about the economy, some of President Trump’s arguments about its strength sounded eerily like those of his predecessor.

title: 6 Takeaways From Trump’s State of the Union
partialText: In an address that was heavy on theatrics, President Trump lashed out at Democrats as “crazy” and unpatriotic.

title: Key Moments from Trump’s State of the Union, and a $1 Million Reward in the Guthrie Case
partialText: Plus, how kids are getting around phone-free classroom rules.

title: Surgeon General Nominee Is Pressed on Vaccine Stance in Confirmation Hearing
partialText: Dr. Casey Means, a wellness influencer and critic of mainstream medicine, is appearing before a Senate committee.

title: How The Times Handles the Congressional Hearing Circus
partialText: Three editors in Washington discuss their approach to coverage of politicians and witnesses who sometimes seem to be performing for the cameras.

title: Hunters and Veterans Are Fighting Trump’s Pick to Oversee Public Lands
partialText: Steve Pearce, President Trump’s nominee to lead the Bureau of Land Management, is set to face a Senate hearing on Wednesday.

title: Court Rules Against Justice Dept. Search of Reporter’s Computers
partialText: The judge said the court itself would search the devices, which were seized from a Washington Post reporter’s home last month.

title: Inside Nicolás Maduro’s Last Days as Venezuela’s Leader
partialText: The Venezuelan leader overestimated his strength and misread his exchange with President Trump in the decisive weeks before his capture by U.S. forces.

title: Thanks, Ukrainians Say, but Please Stop Calling Us Resilient
partialText: Ukraine must project strength to secure continued Western support. But its people want the world to know they are not superhuman.

title: Ukraine Wants to Join the E.U. to Secure Peace. Here’s What to Know.
partialText: Negotiators agree that joining the bloc is critical to Kyiv’s future. But obstacles abound, and compromises might forever change how the union works.

title: Yondr Pouches, a Solution to School Phone Bans, Are No Match for Teens
partialText: In some schools, Yondr, a pouch marketed to keep kids off devices, has proved no match for actual children.

title: How the UK Could Remove Former Prince Andrew From the Royal Line of Succession
partialText: Despite his connections with the sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, the former prince is eighth in line to the British throne. That could change.

title: Maurene Comey, a Prosecutor in Epstein Case, Joins New York Law Firm
partialText: Maurene Comey is joining Patterson Belknap Webb & Tyler. She was abruptly fired by the Trump administration last year after a career as a top federal prosecutor.

title: Can A.I. Detection Tools Really Spot Fake Images and Videos?
partialText: Artificial intelligence detectors are increasingly used to check the veracity of content online. We ran more than 1,000 tests and found several strengths and plenty of weaknesses.

title: Bleak Research Report Stokes A.I. Debate on Wall St.
partialText: In a widely circulated note, Citrini Research painted a dire picture of job losses and stock market sell-offs, though many analysts and economists questioned its conclusions.

title: Delroy Lindo on ‘Sinners,’ the Oscars and the Power of Affirmation
partialText: In a career of standout performances and dispiriting lows, Lindo, 73, has held firm to his goal: “I want to be respected for my work.”

title: International Oscar Favorites Are Offering a Complicated New View of America
partialText: The Oscars has become friendlier to non-English language movies. And the movies seem aware of their American audiences.

title: Online Accusations in Guthrie Abduction Leave One Family ‘Scared Numb’
partialText: A fifth-grade teacher and his principal wife hid in their bedroom as dozens of people who believed he might be a kidnapper appeared on their suburban street.

title: How Mamdani Learned From the First Snowstorm and Prepared for the Second
partialText: As the forecast rapidly worsened, Mayor Zohran Mamdani urged his staff to implement new policies and emphasized the need to communicate aggressively about the snow.

title: Mamdani’s New Social Services Chief Worked to Reduce Street Homelessness
partialText: Mayor Zohran Mamdani selected Erin Dalton, a public official in the Pittsburgh area, to head New York City’s Department of Social Services.

title: Futsal Phenom in Afghanistan Is a Hero the Taliban Didn’t Expect
partialText: A triumph in indoor soccer has turned Alireza Ahmadi, 17, and other players from the Hazara minority, long marginalized in Afghanistan, into national heroes.

title: Germany’s Leader Merz Delivers a Blunt Warning to China on Trade
partialText: Chancellor Friedrich Merz laid out his complaints in a frank message to his hosts on a trip to Beijing that China had designed to showcase their relationship.

title: Best and Worst Moments From Trump’s State of the Union Address
partialText: Eight Opinion writers weigh in on the speech.

title: Jimmy Kimmel Goes Live After a Super Long State of the Union
partialText: “I can’t believe America missed an all-new ‘Will Trent’ for this one,” he joked.

title: A Seasoned French Museum Chief Takes Over a Louvre in Crisis
partialText: Christophe Leribault, who runs the Palace of Versailles, will replace Laurence des Cars, who resigned months after an audacious jewel heist.

title: Pope Leo to Visit Africa, Signaling Continent’s Importance to Catholicism
partialText: The number of Roman Catholics is growing faster in Africa than anywhere else, according to the Vatican.

title: A New York City Diner That Served Blind Residents Has Closed Its Doors
partialText: When Malibu Diner in Chelsea shut down on Sunday night, it ended a unique breakfast program for older people in the city.

title: Abu Dhabi’s State Oil Company Looks Beyond Oil
partialText: Having reshaped the company, Sultan Ahmed Al Jaber wants to expand internationally, particularly in natural gas, chemicals and renewables.
